required_skills: Data Analysis, Python (Programming Language), and SQLAdvertising, Communication, Dashboards, Gameplay, Key Metrics, Knowledge Acquisition, and Teamwork
location: Rovio Entertainment Corporation · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland Reposted  2 weeks ago  · Over 50 applicants
job_description:
At Rovio you will get to work with one of the most famous games IP’s in the world: Angry Birds. Our mission is to “craft joy” for the wide audience that we reach with our games and products. In order to do that, we know that people need to bring their own joy to what we do. That’s why we value work-life balance, say no to crunch culture, and welcome people from all walks of life to join the flock. Today, we are a proud team of 500+ caring and talented professionals representing 54 different nations.We trust our teams to work autonomously by providing them the right tools and level of responsibility. We believe in our teams to remain creative and to keep learning – as well as ensuring everyone has opportunities for personal growth.Data is at the heart of everything we do at Rovio. It enables us to continually improve our games and provide incredible experiences for the millions of users who play our games every day. All of this data is only valuable if it can be used to guide our day to day operations. It is the job of Rovio data craft to turn that raw data into actionable insights for Rovio’s games teams and other business units. The data craft aims to empower Rovio’s teams with insightful data, and also with relevant tools and models that support decision making.We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst who will be a main driver of Ads growth opportunities based on data insights.You will have fun at work by doing: Product/Roadmap Prioritization:Develop in collaboration with the Ad’s team stakeholders, short to mid-term data project roadmap Define priorities and work allocation on weekly meetings with Ads TeamReporting:Building data pipelines and automated analyses using modern scripting methodsBuilding meaningful dashboards that answer business questions and improve decision makingParticipate in data harmonisation processes by defining requirements, implementing ETL processes and ensuring data qualityInsights:Own data-driven projects from ideation to execution and collaborate with business owners and analytics peers alikeStudy changes in key metrics and long-term trends and forecasting Work with game teams to identify white space opportunities for Ads 
Superpowers and skills we are looking for: Ability to turn analyses into purposeful actionDomain knowledge of Ads or Game analyticsProficiency in Python or RUnderstanding of advanced SQLExcellent cooperation and communication skills
Interview process: First meeting: You will meet the TA Partner to get acquainted and learn more about Rovio and the specifics of the role.Call with a Hiring manager: You will catch up for a short call with your potential manager to dive deeper into your skills and also discuss what motivates you.Test: a technical assignment that will take you no longer than 2 hours. Technical panel interview: You will meet some of teammates. Our aim is to get a clear overview of your hard skills and where we can help you develop.Final meeting: You will have a chat with some team members and the relevant stakeholders from other teams. The goal is to discuss your career ambitions and expectations, and also how you would fit with our working culture.

required_skills: Data Analytics, Data Engineering, Data Warehousing, and Extract, Transform, Load (ETL)Apache Kafka, Azure Databricks, Data Flow, Data Lakes, Data Modeling, and English as a Second Language (ESL)
location: OP Financial Group · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland  6 days ago  · 30 applicants
job_description:
Are you ready to embark on an exciting journey into the heart of data transformation in one of Finland’s largest financial institutions? OP Life Insurance is now on the lookout for an accomplished Data Engineer to join our dynamic and growing team in Vallila, Helsinki!What is your future role like?We are currently seeking an experienced data professional to fill the role of Data Engineer and join our growing numbers at OP Life Insurance! At OP, we are making significant investments in enhancing our data capabilities to align with our business strategy. Our focus is on fostering data-driven decision-making and pushing forward the fundamental pillars of our data vision growth, customer experience, and efficiency. We are driving this progress through the application of data and analytics use cases. We are currently in the process of transitioning from on-premises systems to a cloud-based platform, and we're offering you the chance to be a part of this transformation and work with cutting-edge technologies.In your day-to-day work, you will play a crucial role in our ongoing platform transformation, which will support our future business needs. In this renewal, we are transforming our insurance business into a new Guidewire Insurance Suite platform. Thanks to this transformation, in the future we are going to be able to handle insurance, billing & collections and claims all in one platform!Furthermore, as a Data Engineer in OP Life Insurance you will get to work in our risk life renewal program and its data integration team. Your role will include technical data integration, covering both operational integrations and the utilization of operational analytics. In this role, you will have excellent opportunities for continuous professional development and learning from multi-skilled colleagues while simultaneously bringing your own expertise to the table.The opportunity is available in Helsinki and like the rest of OP, we work in a flexible manner, combining both office days and remote work. What we hope from you? Our recruitment is not meant to seem like a puzzle, so we strive to tell you as clearly as possible what kind of expertise we believe is crucial to thriving in this role. Foremost we hope that you are someone with experience with Data Engineering work and thrive to continuously learn more!Here are some of the requirements and technologies you will work with include Experience in Data Engineering, Data Lake, Data Analytics, ETL, ELT, Data Warehouse, Data ModellingUnderstanding of end-to-end Data flow (from difference source systems to Data Lake subsequently different downstream applications for different use cases)Spark/Scala, PythonExperience in processing streaming data ex. reading data from Kafka topicsExperience in DataBricks or Similar ETL/Analytics Platform in cloud AWS-S3Azure
We understand that you might not have experience in all these areas just yet, but what really matters is your motivation and willingness to learn and grow. At OP Life, we also highly value the ability to work effectively within a team and, when needed, the ability to step up and take leadership in projects. Demonstrating initiative, strong teamwork skills, and a positive attitude are essential attributes we seek. We also hope you are able to communicate clearly and understandably in English and/or Finnish, as effective communication is vital for successful collaboration within our diverse team.What We Offer To help counterbalance work where you are expected to take a lot of responsibility, we seek to ensure employee wellbeing and to enable forward-looking work arrangements. We offer a stable working environment where you can contribute to our core values responsibility, people first and succeeding together. You will enjoy a wide range of staff benefits, including a personnel fund and special terms for employee banking, insurance and loan services. We offer comprehensive occupational health care, extensive medical treatment expenses insurance and a full-time group accident insurance policy. Furthermore, we invest in wellbeing at work by encouraging a good work-life balance, providing flexibility in your daily life, and offering lunch, sport and cultural benefits and opportunities for affordable holidays in OP timeshares. We also encourage and help you to further develop yourself as a technical professional. We have the so called “70/20/10 rule” in use, which means you will use 70% of your time for your daily tasks, 20% to develop the way you do those tasks, and the last 10% is reserved for you to learn and try new things. You will also have our OP Software Academy at your disposal in case you are interested in learning new technologies or methodologies, or why not in honing your skills in your current stack. Sounds like your future role? Great – that’s what we were hoping for! The application period is open until Sunday 12.11.2023. Any questions in mind?Our Tech Lead Abhishek Dutta (tel. +358 50 410 4235) will be happy to answer your questions. You can reach Abhishek best on the following dates and times Thursday, November 2nd, from 2 PM to 3 PM and Friday, November 3rd, from 2 PM to 3 PM. Talk to you soon future colleague! In the financial sector, our business is founded on trust and accountability, which is why the successful candidate will be checked for credit history and corporate connections, must take a drug test and a security clearance vetting made by the Finnish Security and Intelligence Service. Equality and diversity are highly valued at OP Financial Group. We welcome job applications from people of all kinds, regardless of their gender identity or age, or the culture or minority group with which they identify. OP Financial Group is the leading financial services group in Finland. Owned by our customers, we are one of the most alluring employers in the Financial sector. OP Financial Group employs over 13,000 professionals and provides banking, asset management, wealth management, insurance and brokerage services for our four million customers. For more information about OP as an employer and for all vacancies, go to www.op-careers.fi

job_description:

As a Data Engineer, you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and maintaining data solutions that enable our clients to make informed business decisions.We design, build and operate modern cloud-based data management solutions - from source data to data driven tools & applications. We advise our customers to set the direction and data driven transformation focus areas. We support them in creating data strategy, designing overall IT landscape architecture and assessing and developing data related capabilities.We work with cutting edge data related technologies in cloud space including like Azure, AWS, Snowflake, Databricks, Spark etc. We are valuable partners with Microsoft and other major BI vendors giving us a great opportunity to learn, grow and apply those technologies in our customer deliveries. We are taking care about data solutions for biggest Nordic companies to help them better understand their customer needs and improve their business.Responsibilities: Design, build, and optimize high-volume batch and real-time data pipelines.Develop and maintain data lake infrastructure, data warehousing, data management platforms and data analytic tools.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and ensure data accuracy and integrity.Implement data governance and security measures.Provide data insights and support to business intelligence (BI) teams.Develop data visualizations to help our customers get the most out of their data.

We believe that our organizational culture is an important part of enabling you to be successful. We provide a flexible hybrid work model as part of our culture and way of working. Finally, we also strongly believe in curiosity and learning as a lifestyle where you need to unlearn and relearn every day as new opportunities emerge.Join us and make your mark!We look forward to your application!Please attach your CV or LinkedIn-profile and we’ll reach out to you. Interviews will be held on a continuous basis, so we encourage you to apply today. If you have any questions regarding this role, please contact hiring manager Juha Anttila via e-mail juha.d.anttila@tietoevry.comHope to hear from you soon!Tietoevry thrives with diversity, and we welcome applicants of all genders, ages, abilities, ethnicities, orientations, beliefs, and backgrounds.About TietoevryTietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. required_skills: Database Development, DevOps, Full-Stack Development, Google Cloud Platform (GCP), MLOps, Machine Learning, and Software DevelopmentCloud Services and System Development
location: Skyfora · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland Reposted  2 days ago  · 36 applicants
job_description:
Skyfora helps measure, predict, and adapt to extreme weather caused by climate change with next-generation AI-powered weather intelligence solutions. This enables better preparedness, improved decision-making, and reduced risk for businesses and human lives. We are seeking a Senior Platform Engineer to be part of this exciting journey. Who we are and what we do?Skyfora is at the forefront of weather intelligence, based in Helsinki, Finland. The company has a drive for innovation and a dedication to advance meteorological research. Skyfora proudly leverages AI in improved weather forecasts optimised for industries affected by weather. It also develops state-of-the-art weather instruments and novel patented weather data gathering methods. We are in a very interesting phase of growth with our groundbreaking technology having already achieved great milestones. Our instruments are being used in real hurricanes by the world´s most renowned hurricane researchers and AI Weather Forecasts are used by companies in the sectors of renewable energy and insurance. We have also recently won the EIC Accelerator grant of 2.5 million EUR and are currently growing our core team in Helsinki. Who are we looking for?We are in search of an experienced and hands-on Senior Engineer to help develop our AI Weather Forecast platform and to secure successful delivery of AI Weather Forecast projects. You will have a pivotal role in designing and implementing the platform used for AI Weather Forecasts and customer-specific projects. In our small yet dynamic company, we're looking for someone who is not only enthusiastic staying abreast of industry movements and best practices but also deeply committed to hands-on development. As the team grows this role will have a lot of growth opportunity depending on the applicant´s ambitions. Requirements Proven 5+ years of software and system development experience, ideally within the realm of AI-based products.Demonstrable back-end proficiency with front-/full stack experience being a big bonus.Hand-on experience with leading cloud solutions GCP, AWS, and/or AzureData Lake, Data Warehouse and Database expertise
 Preferred DevOps and, ideally MLOps is considered a strong bonus.Track record of developing a product or platform to market.We work with meteorological data, so having prior experience in either weather data or mathematical modelling would be a significant advantage.
 Why join us? Impact: With us, you get to be part of building pioneering solutions that respond to the operational and humanitarian requirements caused by climate change.Technology: You will have a chance to work with technology that is unique, proprietary, and bleeding edge.Culture: You will be working with a supportive, highly ambitious, yet fun-loving, and entrepreneurial team with minimal bureaucracy. We value the well-being of our staff and a healthy work life balance. We aim to make sure that every team member feels valued and happy in Skyfora.Compensation: Competitive salary with stock options because we want you to be part of our journey.
 If you are passionate about pushing boundaries, exploring uncharted territories, and want to be part of a dynamic team, then this is the place for you. Together, we will continue to redefine what is possible.  Contact details and additional information:For inquiries or to learn more about this opportunity, please reach out to:admin (at) Skyfora.comAdditionally, we have dedicated phone slots available to reach CEO Fredrik Borgström (Tel. +358 40 564 4498) at the following times:  Friday, November 3rd, 2023 from 1 to 4 pmFriday, November 10th, 2023 from 1 to 4 pm
 Please apply the latest by November 15th, 2023. The position may also be filled prior to the latest application date if a suitable candidate is found.

job_title: 4 Data Engineeriä ja Cloud Data Engineer
required_skills: Cloud Computing, Cloud Infrastructure, DevOps, Google Cloud Platform (GCP), SQL, and Software DevelopmentAmazon EC2, Cascading Style Sheets (CSS), Kubernetes, and Troubleshooting
location: Fennia · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland Reposted  3 days ago  · Over 50 applicants
job_description:
Fenniassa on käynnissä historiamme suurin muutoshanke, Tulevaisuuden Fennia, jonka tavoitteena on uudistaa toimintaamme vastaamaan entistäkin paremmin asiakkaidemme tulevaisuuden tarpeita. Tulevaisuuden Fenniassa data ja analytiikka ovat toimintamme peruspilareita. Jos siis koet sydämesi sykkivän datalle, analytiikan mahdollisuuksille sekä asiakkaiden elämän helpottamiselle, tutustu tehtävään alla tarkemmin ja tartu tilaisuuteen!Haemme Data ja Analytiikka -yksikköömme neljää Data Engineeriä ja yhtä Cloud Data Engineeriä. Tehtävässä vastaat nimetyn vastuuyksikkösi datoista sekä niiden kehittämisestä ja ylläpitämisestä yhdessä osaavien tiimikavereidesi ja liiketoimintayksiköiden kanssa. Varmistat, että datan ja analytiikan ratkaisut auttavat Fenniaa saavuttamaan liiketoiminnan tavoitteet ja että käytämme parhaita menetelmiä, teknologioita ja työkaluja tiedon hyödyntämisessä ja analysoinnissa.Yhdessä tiimimme vastaa, että tuottamamme ratkaisut vastaavat koko Fennian liiketoiminnan tarpeisiin. Reilussa tiimissäsi työskentelee noin 10 kehittyvää data-ammattilaista, joilla on osaamista datan kehittämisen eri alueilla. Rohkeat liiketoimintayksiköt ovat parhaita ystäviämme, joten pääset tekemään tiivistä yhteistyötä liiketoiminnan kehittämisessä datan asiantuntijana. Yhteisenä tavoitteenamme on saada datasta ja analytiikasta kaikki hyöty asiakkaidemme yrittämistä ja elämää varten.Sinulta odotamme:Toivomme, että sinulla on kokemusta tietovaraston kehittämisestä, mallintamisesta, ylläpidosta ja ajojen orkestroinnista, sekä SQL:n käytöstä. Sinulla on huolellinen työskentelyote, koska datan laatu ja eheys on meille tärkeää ja sääntelynmukaisuus ohjaa toimintaamme. Työskentelemme suomeksi ja englanniksi, joten molempien osaaminen on tarpeen.Lisäksi arvostamme: Kokemusta tietokannoistaJonkin ETL-työkalun tuntemustaKokemusta kyselyjen suorituskykyjen optimoinnistaKokemusta versionhallinnasta, sillä työmme versioidaanVakuutusliiketoiminnan tuntemustaYmmärrystä pilviteknologioista 
Cloud Data Engineerin tehtävässä eduksi on myös kokemus datan kehittämisestä AWS:ssä, Pythonin osaaminen sekä kokemus API:en kehittämisestä.Me Fenniassa uskomme, että halulla oppia jatkuvasti uutta pärjää pitkälle. Joten jos tuntuu, että olisit kiinnostunut, mutta jotain vaatimuksia jää täyttämättä, niin ei haittaa. Hakemusta vain sisälle niin jutellaan. Meillä menestyy innovatiivinen henkilö, joka nauttii uusien tiedolla johtamisen ratkaisujen keksimisestä vakuutustoiminnan tarpeisiin.Miksi sinun kannattaa tarttua tilaisuuteen?Data ja sen kehittäminen on keskeinen osa Fennian strategiaa, joten meillä pääset merkittävään rooliin tiedolla johdetussa vakuutusyhtiössä. Pääset kehittämään, vaikuttamaan ja hyödyntämään osaamistasi laajasti. Työyhteisömme on ammattitaitoinen ja motivoitunut. Fennian arvoihin oletkin jo tutustunut, jos luit ilmoituksen tarkasti. Ne ovat Yhdessä, Reilu, Vastuullisesti rohkea ja Kehittyvä.Tarjoamme vakituisen työtehtävän vakavaraisessa ja vahvan perustan omaavassa vakuutusalan konsernissa, jossa vallitsee edistämisen kulttuuri. Kattavan perehdytyksen lisäksi rohkaisemme työntekijöitämme jatkuvaan itsensä kehittämiseen ja tarjoammekin aktiivisesti mahdollisuuksia lisäkoulutukseen. Näin mahdollistamme sinulle kehittyvän tehtäväkentän ja mielekkäät työtehtävätTulet työskentelemään hyvien kulkuyhteyksien varrella Triplan läheisyydessä Länsi-Pasilassa. Arkea sujuvoittavat liukuva työaika ja mahdollisuus etätyöhön. Koemme, että työhyvinvoinnista huolehtiminen on tärkeämpää kuin koskaan ennen, ja tuemme henkilöstömme hyvinvointia mm. liikunta-, pyörä- ja vakuutuseduin. Tavoitteenamme on, että jokainen fennialainen voi yhdistää työn ja vapaa-ajan hyvinvointia maksimoivalla tavalla.Kiinnostuitko tehtävästä? Hae siis nyt!Lisätietoja tehtävästä antaa Cloud Data Platform Manager Juha Järvi, jonka tavoitat parhaiten keskiviikkoisin klo 12-13 numerosta 040 178 4629.Pyrimme löytämään sopivat henkilöt mahdollisimman pian, joten hakemus kannattaa jättää heti. Haethan kuitenkin viimeistään 30.11. Haastattelemme hakijoita jo hakuaikana ja myös valintoja voidaan tehdä ennen hakuajan päättymistä.Toimintamme Fennialla perustuu vastuullisuuteen ja luottamukseen, joten vakituiseen ja pitkään määräaikaiseen työsuhteeseen tulevalle teetetään työhöntulotarkastus, johon sisältyy huumausainetesti.Fennia arvostaa yhdenvertaisuutta ja monimuotoisuutta työyhteisössä. Meille ovat tervetulleita kaikki hakijat taustoista, iästä, sukupuolesta ja eri kieli-, kulttuuri- ja vähemmistöryhmistä riippumatta.

required_skills: Computer Science, Data Warehousing, Databases, and Extract, Transform, Load (ETL)Business Understanding, Communication, Data Modeling, Snowflake, Snowflake Cloud, and Wizard
location: Schibsted Finland · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland  2 days ago  · 29 applicants
job_description:
THE OPPORTUNITY IN A NUTSHELLYou? A data engineer with an analytic mindset or an analyst with data engineering skills. Whether you have a few years of experience or have been around for a while, we’re interested in hearing from you.Role? As a Data Warehouse Engineer in our company, you will take part in constructing state-of-the-art Data Warehouses tailored for Nordic Marketplaces, empowering data-informed decisions. You will collaborate closely with stakeholders and cross-functional teams to engineer robust, agile solutions.Tech stack? AWS, Snowflake, Redshift, Matillion, Python, DBT, TableauLocation? You can apply to work at one of our hubs in Aarhus or Helsinki. Most of us work some days from home a couple of days a week and love meeting our colleagues weekly for collaboration. If you like, you can of course work from the office every day.Company? FINN.no in Norway, Bilbasen and DBA in Denmark, Oikotie and Tori in Finland, and Blocket in Sweden, recently joined forces, collectively forming Schibsted Nordic Marketplaces. Together, we serve over 325 million monthly visits in the Nordics. By joining forces, we are on a transformative journey toward becoming a next-generation marketplace. To achieve this ambitious goal, we're building a marketplace platform that will propel our verticals (Jobs, Mobility, Real Estate, ReCommerce) to a leading position in all countries. Our technology unit is instrumental to our success story, deploying new code to production over 1800 times per week.Why us? In this role, you will have an unique opportunity to build and form the Data Warehouse for Nordic Marketplaces to empower the organisation to take data driven decisions. We believe that the best solutions come in collaboration with others and that freedom and a sense of responsibility are more effective than detailed management.Sounds like your cup of tea? Check out the details below!WHO ARE YOU? A data wizard with at least Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (Computer science, Mathematics, Statistics, Finance) Passionate about data as basis of analysis and decision support Profound business understanding and communication skills Manages fundamental data modelling techniques relevant to data warehousing Experience with our tech stack or equivalent ETL/ELT tools like Talend, BODS, Informatica or other data wrangling tools like DBT, Databricks, Fivetran, Spark, Airflow etc and you don’t need ChatGPT to write your SQL Experience with AWS services like Snowflake, S3, Lambda or other cloud platforms and comparable tools 
WHAT’S THE JOB LIKE?Day-to-day work & projects cookingAs a part of our team you will work in close collaboration with both domain teams and analysts as well as your peers within our team and sister teams. Having a structured and analytical mindset is essential, as well as being able to decipher domain data models and data products, and transform those into analytical models to support business requirements by analysts and other stakeholders. You will be working with building high quality data pipelines to feed those models for different verticals as well as horizontal models across. This will be done using the Schibsted Common Analytical Model as one of the core building blocks.ColleaguesWe are a large, distributed and highly diverse team spread across most out the Nordics and Poland. Our team consists of 12 people, with broad diversity in both background and age-span. We're part of the data platform area, together with other teams like data platform engineering, data management, recommendation as well as data enablement teams for data science and data mesh. We are one out of 50 teams of talented individuals with diverse backgrounds, intellects and identities.We work closely with the technical domain teams to understand the data we are dealing with as well as our main stakeholders within insight and analysts as well as functions like finance and sales. We work according to agile principles with continuous deployment and improvements. We meet up several times during the year in our different locations.Not everything is cotton candy clouds, so here’s the main opportunity to improveRight now we are navigating around in the new, Nordic organisation, balancing both the legacy systems while building the new stuff, which is both demanding and exciting at the same time.On the other hand, this brings along a great opportunity to leave your fingerprint on how our future Data Warehouse is drafted and to support the rest of the organisation with key metrics and analyses both during and after the transition! Is your curious mind asking for this kind of adventure?GOT YOUR ATTENTION? Let us hear from you!If you are looking for a workplace and the role in which you could share your knowledge and expertise, learn and grow, get inspired, be yourself, and make a difference, let us hear from you by 20.11.2023. We value diversity and welcome applicants from all backgrounds.QUESTIONS?Engineering Manager Kristin Hybertsen is happy to provide information about the daily work and answer any questions you may have about the role. Kristin is best reached through Linkedin or email kristin.hybertsen(at)schibsted.com

location: Cloud1 Oy · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland Reposted  3 weeks ago  · Over 50 applicants
job_description:
Cloud1 tunnetaan vaativien integraatio-, arkkitehtuuri- ja dataratkaisujen toteuttajana. Tehtävämme on kehittää asiakkaidemme liiketoimintaa ja tuottaa heille kilpailuetua. Teemme sen rakentamalla älykkäitä pilvipohjaisia ratkaisuja Microsoft Azure -teknologialla. Olemme monialainen dataosaajien joukko, ja ainutlaatuinen tapamme työskennellä on saanut laajasti kiitosta. Näemme, että maailmassa on paikka meidän tavallamme tehdä asioita.Kiinnostavatko sinua Azure tekeminen sekä data platform kehittäminen? Ovatko visionäärisyys, modernit teknologiat, työympäristö sekä järkevät toimintatavat sinulle avaintekijöitä? Meillä tehdään töitä hyvässä hengessä yhteistyössä kumppaneiden ja asiakkaiden kanssa. Edistämme aidosti niin omia kuin asiakkaiden kyvykkyyksiä hyödyntäen Azuren teknologioita ja käytäntöjä.MeistäOlemme nopeasti kasvava Azuren data-analytiikka ratkaisuihin erikoistuva konsulttitalo, joka auttaa yrityksiä maksimoimaan dataan pohjautuvan päätöksen teon ja sen hyödyntämisen potentiaalin. Arvoihimme kuuluvat – Inhimillisyys, Reiluus, Visionäärisyys, Ammattimaisuus sekä Asiantuntijuus, mitkä näkyvät toiminnassamme. Cloud1 on 2012 vuonna perustettu neljän Microsoftin teknologiaekspertin toimesta. Nykyään yli 70-henkinen yritys koostuu raudankovista osaajista sekä tulevaisuuden lupauksista. Meillä on vankka ymmärrys integraatioista, tietokannoista, raportoinnista sekä infrastruktuurista. Olemme Microsoftin kumppaneita seuraavissa kategorioissa: Digital & App Innovation, Data & AI sekä Infrastructure, jotka mahdollistavat pääsyn ensimmäisten joukossa uusiin teknologioihin sekä toimimisen haastavissa ja mielenkiintoisissa projekteissa. Takana on jo yli 600 Azure- ja data-alusta projektia.Meillä pääset toteuttamaan vaihtelevia ja haastaviakin hankkeita yhdessä alan kovimpien osaajien kanssa. Rohkaisemme sinua kehittämään osaamistasi jatkuvasti, ja tarjoamme käyttöösi aina uusimmat Azure-teknologiat. Vaikka saatkin vapautta ja vastuuta työsi tekemiseen, emme Cloud1:lla työskentele yksin. Tiimi ja koko Cloud1-yhteisö ovat aina tukenasi rennolla ja hyvällä meiningillä ilman turhaa byrokratiaa. Tervetuloa mukaan innostavaan ja kehittävään työyhteisöön!TehtävänkuvausAzure Data Engineer -roolissa suunnittelet ja toteutat teknisiä ratkaisuja vaihtelevissa pilviprojekteissa alan uusimmilla teknologioilla. Hyödynnät osaamistasi tietokannoista, integraatioista ja tietomallinnuksesta asiakkaidemme liiketoiminnan kehittämiseksi. Voit vaikuttaa omaan tehtävänkuvaasi osaamisesi, vahvuuksiesi ja toiveidesi mukaan.Sinulla on muutaman vuoden kokemus tietovarastoinnista (esim. ETL) tai integraatioista, ja erityisesti Microsoft SQL Server -tietokannoista. Toivomme sinulta teknisten taitojen lisäksi kokemusta tiimityöstä asiakasrajapinnassa ja kykyä edistää kehitystyötä itsenäisesti. Arvostamme kokemusta Azuresta, Microsoft on-premises -analytiikkaratkaisuista ja Master Data Managementista, mutta kokemusta tärkeämpää on halusi oppia ja kehittyä kivenkovaksi Azure-osaajaksi.Azure Data Engineerin työtehtävät voivat vaihdella projekteittain, mutta tehtäviisi voi kuulua esimerkiksi: Tietovarastojen ja data-alustojen suunnittelu ja toteutus Azure-pilvessäDatan integrointi eri järjestelmistä AzureenAnalytiikkaratkaisujen suunnittelu ja toteutus Azure-pilvessäDatamallinnuksen suunnittelu ja toteutusTietoturvallisuuden varmistaminen datan käsittelyssäTiimityöskentely asiakkaiden ja muiden sidosryhmien kanssa
Työhön liittyvät edutHaluamme sinun viihtyvän meillä ja suoriutuvan työsi tekemisestä niin, että sinulla on siihen tarvittavat edut ja työvälineet. Tätä tukeaksemme tarjoamme sinulle:Modernit työvälineetKannustava bonusmalliHenkilöstön palkkiorahasto ja osakeantiSertifioinnit ja erilliset koulutuksetLaaja työterveyshuolto sekä vapaa-ajan tapaturmavakuutusLiikunta- ja kulttuurietu, hierontaetu, työmatkaetu ja lounasetuPuhelinetuOma CS & PUBG-tiimi sekä erilaiset harrastekerhotVirkistystoiminta – tapahtumat ja yhteiset aamiaisetAamiais- ja välipalatarvikkeet toimistollaVuosittainen etätyömatka mukavien työkavereiden kanssaToimistomme sijaitsee Vuorikadulla aivan Helsingin ytimessä, hyvien kulkuyhteyksien äärellä. Työtä tehdään hybridimallilla eli osittain toimistolla ja valitsemastasi paikasta.Kiinnostuitko?Hae uuteen vakituiseen tehtävään alla olevan painikkeen kautta, tai ota yhteyttä ja kysy lisää! Hakuaika päättyy 31.10.

required_skills: Artificial Intelligence (AI), Computer Science, Data Mining, Data Science, MLOps, Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing (NLP), Pattern Recognition, and Software DevelopmentCadence Encounter
location: Wolt · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland Reposted  3 days ago  · Over 50 applicants
job_description:
Job DescriptionTeam purpose and mission Working embedded with Data Scientists and other engineers to develop, deploy, scale and maintain impactful Machine Learning solutionsHelping data scientists and other engineers with Machine Learning and ML Platform & infrastructure related topics and questions. Increasing the level of ML engineering in the team.Monitoring, maintenance and troubleshooting of deployed solutionsContributing to our MLOps practices and liaising with the ML Platform teamWe have openings in multiple domains, such as personalisation & recommendations, search, logistics etc.
📍This role can be based in one of our tech hubs in Helsinki, Berlin or Stockholm, or you can work remotely anywhere in Finland, Sweden, Germany, Denmark, and Estonia. Read more about our remote setup here. If you live outside of these countries - not to worry! We provide relocation support to help you make your way to Finland, Germany or Sweden.Our humble expectations You are experienced in end-to-end machine learning deployments and maintenance of deployed solutions and have at least 3+ years of experience in ML/MLOps.Furthermore, you bring solid experience in scaling and troubleshooting machine learning deployments to the table. You can help with the technical issues the teams encounter.A good understanding of ML and MLOps principles as well as Software engineering experience in Python should complete your profile.Ideally you also have experience in Docker, Kubernetes, Flyte, Seldon Core.
Next StepsThe position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Michal SzafraniecAbout WoltWolt is a technology company that makes it incredibly easy to discover and get the best restaurants, grocery stores and other local shops delivered to your home or office. Wolt is not just a delivery app – we’re a technology company building a commerce platform to seamlessly connect our millions of customers with thousands of merchant and courier partners, in real-time across 23 countries and 250+ cities. Our apps (iOS and Android) have the industry’s highest ratings, largely thanks to our customer-first-mindset, which shows in how we build products and run operations. In June 2022 we officially joined forces with DoorDash. Combined, we have a presence in 27 countries, 23 of which operate with the Wolt brand and app. Wolt and DoorDash continue largely independently, with Wolt’s name, brand, product, technology and team.Working in Product Development at WoltAt Wolt, we’re about getting things done. You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 400+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we’re the very core of Wolt’s products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 40 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & InclusionWe want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.Join us today to build Wolt together!

required_skills: Data Analysis, Python (Programming Language), and SQLAdvertising, Communication, Dashboards, Gameplay, Key Metrics, Knowledge Acquisition, and Teamwork
location: Rovio Entertainment Corporation · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland Reposted  2 weeks ago  · Over 50 applicants
job_description:
At Rovio you will get to work with one of the most famous games IP’s in the world: Angry Birds. Our mission is to “craft joy” for the wide audience that we reach with our games and products. In order to do that, we know that people need to bring their own joy to what we do. That’s why we value work-life balance, say no to crunch culture, and welcome people from all walks of life to join the flock. Today, we are a proud team of 500+ caring and talented professionals representing 54 different nations.We trust our teams to work autonomously by providing them the right tools and level of responsibility. We believe in our teams to remain creative and to keep learning – as well as ensuring everyone has opportunities for personal growth.Data is at the heart of everything we do at Rovio. It enables us to continually improve our games and provide incredible experiences for the millions of users who play our games every day. All of this data is only valuable if it can be used to guide our day to day operations. It is the job of Rovio data craft to turn that raw data into actionable insights for Rovio’s games teams and other business units. The data craft aims to empower Rovio’s teams with insightful data, and also with relevant tools and models that support decision making.We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst who will be a main driver of Ads growth opportunities based on data insights.You will have fun at work by doing: Product/Roadmap Prioritization:Develop in collaboration with the Ad’s team stakeholders, short to mid-term data project roadmap Define priorities and work allocation on weekly meetings with Ads TeamReporting:Building data pipelines and automated analyses using modern scripting methodsBuilding meaningful dashboards that answer business questions and improve decision makingParticipate in data harmonisation processes by defining requirements, implementing ETL processes and ensuring data qualityInsights:Own data-driven projects from ideation to execution and collaborate with business owners and analytics peers alikeStudy changes in key metrics and long-term trends and forecasting Work with game teams to identify white space opportunities for Ads 
Superpowers and skills we are looking for: Ability to turn analyses into purposeful actionDomain knowledge of Ads or Game analyticsProficiency in Python or RUnderstanding of advanced SQLExcellent cooperation and communication skills
Interview process: First meeting: You will meet the TA Partner to get acquainted and learn more about Rovio and the specifics of the role.Call with a Hiring manager: You will catch up for a short call with your potential manager to dive deeper into your skills and also discuss what motivates you.Test: a technical assignment that will take you no longer than 2 hours. Technical panel interview: You will meet some of teammates. Our aim is to get a clear overview of your hard skills and where we can help you develop.Final meeting: You will have a chat with some team members and the relevant stakeholders from other teams. The goal is to discuss your career ambitions and expectations, and also how you would fit with our working culture.

required_skills: Data Analytics, Data Engineering, Data Warehousing, and Extract, Transform, Load (ETL)Apache Kafka, Azure Databricks, Data Flow, Data Lakes, Data Modeling, and English as a Second Language (ESL)
location: OP Financial Group · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland  6 days ago  · 30 applicants
job_description:
Are you ready to embark on an exciting journey into the heart of data transformation in one of Finland’s largest financial institutions? OP Life Insurance is now on the lookout for an accomplished Data Engineer to join our dynamic and growing team in Vallila, Helsinki!What is your future role like?We are currently seeking an experienced data professional to fill the role of Data Engineer and join our growing numbers at OP Life Insurance! At OP, we are making significant investments in enhancing our data capabilities to align with our business strategy. Our focus is on fostering data-driven decision-making and pushing forward the fundamental pillars of our data vision growth, customer experience, and efficiency. We are driving this progress through the application of data and analytics use cases. We are currently in the process of transitioning from on-premises systems to a cloud-based platform, and we're offering you the chance to be a part of this transformation and work with cutting-edge technologies.In your day-to-day work, you will play a crucial role in our ongoing platform transformation, which will support our future business needs. In this renewal, we are transforming our insurance business into a new Guidewire Insurance Suite platform. Thanks to this transformation, in the future we are going to be able to handle insurance, billing & collections and claims all in one platform!Furthermore, as a Data Engineer in OP Life Insurance you will get to work in our risk life renewal program and its data integration team. Your role will include technical data integration, covering both operational integrations and the utilization of operational analytics. In this role, you will have excellent opportunities for continuous professional development and learning from multi-skilled colleagues while simultaneously bringing your own expertise to the table.The opportunity is available in Helsinki and like the rest of OP, we work in a flexible manner, combining both office days and remote work. What we hope from you? Our recruitment is not meant to seem like a puzzle, so we strive to tell you as clearly as possible what kind of expertise we believe is crucial to thriving in this role. Foremost we hope that you are someone with experience with Data Engineering work and thrive to continuously learn more!Here are some of the requirements and technologies you will work with include Experience in Data Engineering, Data Lake, Data Analytics, ETL, ELT, Data Warehouse, Data ModellingUnderstanding of end-to-end Data flow (from difference source systems to Data Lake subsequently different downstream applications for different use cases)Spark/Scala, PythonExperience in processing streaming data ex. reading data from Kafka topicsExperience in DataBricks or Similar ETL/Analytics Platform in cloud AWS-S3Azure
We understand that you might not have experience in all these areas just yet, but what really matters is your motivation and willingness to learn and grow. At OP Life, we also highly value the ability to work effectively within a team and, when needed, the ability to step up and take leadership in projects. Demonstrating initiative, strong teamwork skills, and a positive attitude are essential attributes we seek. We also hope you are able to communicate clearly and understandably in English and/or Finnish, as effective communication is vital for successful collaboration within our diverse team.What We Offer To help counterbalance work where you are expected to take a lot of responsibility, we seek to ensure employee wellbeing and to enable forward-looking work arrangements. We offer a stable working environment where you can contribute to our core values responsibility, people first and succeeding together. You will enjoy a wide range of staff benefits, including a personnel fund and special terms for employee banking, insurance and loan services. We offer comprehensive occupational health care, extensive medical treatment expenses insurance and a full-time group accident insurance policy. Furthermore, we invest in wellbeing at work by encouraging a good work-life balance, providing flexibility in your daily life, and offering lunch, sport and cultural benefits and opportunities for affordable holidays in OP timeshares. We also encourage and help you to further develop yourself as a technical professional. We have the so called “70/20/10 rule” in use, which means you will use 70% of your time for your daily tasks, 20% to develop the way you do those tasks, and the last 10% is reserved for you to learn and try new things. You will also have our OP Software Academy at your disposal in case you are interested in learning new technologies or methodologies, or why not in honing your skills in your current stack. Sounds like your future role? Great – that’s what we were hoping for! The application period is open until Sunday 12.11.2023. Any questions in mind?Our Tech Lead Abhishek Dutta (tel. +358 50 410 4235) will be happy to answer your questions. You can reach Abhishek best on the following dates and times Thursday, November 2nd, from 2 PM to 3 PM and Friday, November 3rd, from 2 PM to 3 PM. Talk to you soon future colleague! In the financial sector, our business is founded on trust and accountability, which is why the successful candidate will be checked for credit history and corporate connections, must take a drug test and a security clearance vetting made by the Finnish Security and Intelligence Service. Equality and diversity are highly valued at OP Financial Group. We welcome job applications from people of all kinds, regardless of their gender identity or age, or the culture or minority group with which they identify. OP Financial Group is the leading financial services group in Finland. Owned by our customers, we are one of the most alluring employers in the Financial sector. OP Financial Group employs over 13,000 professionals and provides banking, asset management, wealth management, insurance and brokerage services for our four million customers. For more information about OP as an employer and for all vacancies, go to www.op-careers.fi

job_description:
You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.Tietoevry Tech Services is seeking a highly skilled and dynamic Data Engineer to join our innovative team. As a Data Engineer, you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and maintaining data solutions that enable our clients to make informed business decisions.We design, build and operate modern cloud-based data management solutions - from source data to data driven tools & applications. We advise our customers to set the direction and data driven transformation focus areas. We support them in creating data strategy, designing overall IT landscape architecture and assessing and developing data related capabilities.We work with cutting edge data related technologies in cloud space including like Azure, AWS, Snowflake, Databricks, Spark etc. We are valuable partners with Microsoft and other major BI vendors giving us a great opportunity to learn, grow and apply those technologies in our customer deliveries. We are taking care about data solutions for biggest Nordic companies to help them better understand their customer needs and improve their business.Responsibilities: Design, build, and optimize high-volume batch and real-time data pipelines.Develop and maintain data lake infrastructure, data warehousing, data management platforms and data analytic tools.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and ensure data accuracy and integrity.Implement data governance and security measures.Provide data insights and support to business intelligence (BI) teams.Develop data visualizations to help our customers get the most out of their data.
Requirements: Minimum 2-3 years of relevant work experience in data engineering or a related field.Fluency in both Finnish and English, with excellent written and verbal communication skills.Experience working in modern cloud environments, such as AWS, Azure, or GCP.Solid understanding of data lake infrastructure, data warehousing and data analytic tools.Proven hands-on experience in building high-volume batch and real-time data pipelines.Familiarity with business intelligence tools, preferably MS Power BI.Familiarity with DataOps Management platform solutions, such as ADEStrong problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and ability to work independently.Experience in data analytics and data visualization tools is highly valuable.Interest for self-development, keeping up with new possibilities and technologies available to help our customers to reach their data goals and beyond. For example through GenAI based solutions.
Location:This position is based in Finland.Employment Type:Full-timeWhat’s in it for you?We offer you professional growth, meaningful projects with the latest technologies, open culture, and an outstanding work-life balance! We offer you an opportunity to create the future of a growing and fast developing and important sector. We believe that our organizational culture is an important part of enabling you to be successful. We provide a flexible hybrid work model as part of our culture and way of working. Finally, we also strongly believe in curiosity and learning as a lifestyle where you need to unlearn and relearn every day as new opportunities emerge.Join us and make your mark!We look forward to your application!Please attach your CV or LinkedIn-profile and we’ll reach out to you. Interviews will be held on a continuous basis, so we encourage you to apply today. If you have any questions regarding this role, please contact hiring manager Juha Anttila via e-mail juha.d.anttila@tietoevry.comHope to hear from you soon!Tietoevry thrives with diversity, and we welcome applicants of all genders, ages, abilities, ethnicities, orientations, beliefs, and backgrounds.About TietoevryTietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive.Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of enterprise and public-sector customers in more than 90 countries. Tietoevry’s annual turnover is approximately EUR 3 billion and the company’s shares are listed on the NASDAQ exchange in Helsinki and Stockholm, as well as on Oslo Børs.We create purposeful technology to reinvent the world for good!

location: Skyfora · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland Reposted  2 days ago  · 36 applicants
job_description:
Skyfora helps measure, predict, and adapt to extreme weather caused by climate change with next-generation AI-powered weather intelligence solutions. This enables better preparedness, improved decision-making, and reduced risk for businesses and human lives. We are seeking a Senior Platform Engineer to be part of this exciting journey. Who we are and what we do?Skyfora is at the forefront of weather intelligence, based in Helsinki, Finland. The company has a drive for innovation and a dedication to advance meteorological research. Skyfora proudly leverages AI in improved weather forecasts optimised for industries affected by weather. It also develops state-of-the-art weather instruments and novel patented weather data gathering methods. We are in a very interesting phase of growth with our groundbreaking technology having already achieved great milestones. Our instruments are being used in real hurricanes by the world´s most renowned hurricane researchers and AI Weather Forecasts are used by companies in the sectors of renewable energy and insurance. We have also recently won the EIC Accelerator grant of 2.5 million EUR and are currently growing our core team in Helsinki. Who are we looking for?We are in search of an experienced and hands-on Senior Engineer to help develop our AI Weather Forecast platform and to secure successful delivery of AI Weather Forecast projects. You will have a pivotal role in designing and implementing the platform used for AI Weather Forecasts and customer-specific projects. In our small yet dynamic company, we're looking for someone who is not only enthusiastic staying abreast of industry movements and best practices but also deeply committed to hands-on development. As the team grows this role will have a lot of growth opportunity depending on the applicant´s ambitions. Requirements Proven 5+ years of software and system development experience, ideally within the realm of AI-based products.Demonstrable back-end proficiency with front-/full stack experience being a big bonus.Hand-on experience with leading cloud solutions GCP, AWS, and/or AzureData Lake, Data Warehouse and Database expertise
 Preferred DevOps and, ideally MLOps is considered a strong bonus.Track record of developing a product or platform to market.We work with meteorological data, so having prior experience in either weather data or mathematical modelling would be a significant advantage.
 Why join us? Impact: With us, you get to be part of building pioneering solutions that respond to the operational and humanitarian requirements caused by climate change.Technology: You will have a chance to work with technology that is unique, proprietary, and bleeding edge.Culture: You will be working with a supportive, highly ambitious, yet fun-loving, and entrepreneurial team with minimal bureaucracy. We value the well-being of our staff and a healthy work life balance. We aim to make sure that every team member feels valued and happy in Skyfora.Compensation: Competitive salary with stock options because we want you to be part of our journey.
 If you are passionate about pushing boundaries, exploring uncharted territories, and want to be part of a dynamic team, then this is the place for you. Together, we will continue to redefine what is possible.  Contact details and additional information:For inquiries or to learn more about this opportunity, please reach out to:admin (at) Skyfora.comAdditionally, we have dedicated phone slots available to reach CEO Fredrik Borgström (Tel. +358 40 564 4498) at the following times:  Friday, November 3rd, 2023 from 1 to 4 pmFriday, November 10th, 2023 from 1 to 4 pm
 Please apply the latest by November 15th, 2023. The position may also be filled prior to the latest application date if a suitable candidate is found.

job_title: 4 Data Engineeriä ja Cloud Data Engineer
required_skills: Cloud Computing, Cloud Infrastructure, DevOps, Google Cloud Platform (GCP), SQL, and Software DevelopmentAmazon EC2, Cascading Style Sheets (CSS), Kubernetes, and Troubleshooting
location: Fennia · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland Reposted  3 days ago  · Over 50 applicants
job_description:
Fenniassa on käynnissä historiamme suurin muutoshanke, Tulevaisuuden Fennia, jonka tavoitteena on uudistaa toimintaamme vastaamaan entistäkin paremmin asiakkaidemme tulevaisuuden tarpeita. Tulevaisuuden Fenniassa data ja analytiikka ovat toimintamme peruspilareita. Jos siis koet sydämesi sykkivän datalle, analytiikan mahdollisuuksille sekä asiakkaiden elämän helpottamiselle, tutustu tehtävään alla tarkemmin ja tartu tilaisuuteen!Haemme Data ja Analytiikka -yksikköömme neljää Data Engineeriä ja yhtä Cloud Data Engineeriä. Tehtävässä vastaat nimetyn vastuuyksikkösi datoista sekä niiden kehittämisestä ja ylläpitämisestä yhdessä osaavien tiimikavereidesi ja liiketoimintayksiköiden kanssa. Varmistat, että datan ja analytiikan ratkaisut auttavat Fenniaa saavuttamaan liiketoiminnan tavoitteet ja että käytämme parhaita menetelmiä, teknologioita ja työkaluja tiedon hyödyntämisessä ja analysoinnissa.Yhdessä tiimimme vastaa, että tuottamamme ratkaisut vastaavat koko Fennian liiketoiminnan tarpeisiin. Reilussa tiimissäsi työskentelee noin 10 kehittyvää data-ammattilaista, joilla on osaamista datan kehittämisen eri alueilla. Rohkeat liiketoimintayksiköt ovat parhaita ystäviämme, joten pääset tekemään tiivistä yhteistyötä liiketoiminnan kehittämisessä datan asiantuntijana. Yhteisenä tavoitteenamme on saada datasta ja analytiikasta kaikki hyöty asiakkaidemme yrittämistä ja elämää varten.Sinulta odotamme:Toivomme, että sinulla on kokemusta tietovaraston kehittämisestä, mallintamisesta, ylläpidosta ja ajojen orkestroinnista, sekä SQL:n käytöstä. Sinulla on huolellinen työskentelyote, koska datan laatu ja eheys on meille tärkeää ja sääntelynmukaisuus ohjaa toimintaamme. Työskentelemme suomeksi ja englanniksi, joten molempien osaaminen on tarpeen.Lisäksi arvostamme: Kokemusta tietokannoistaJonkin ETL-työkalun tuntemustaKokemusta kyselyjen suorituskykyjen optimoinnistaKokemusta versionhallinnasta, sillä työmme versioidaanVakuutusliiketoiminnan tuntemustaYmmärrystä pilviteknologioista 
Cloud Data Engineerin tehtävässä eduksi on myös kokemus datan kehittämisestä AWS:ssä, Pythonin osaaminen sekä kokemus API:en kehittämisestä.Me Fenniassa uskomme, että halulla oppia jatkuvasti uutta pärjää pitkälle. Joten jos tuntuu, että olisit kiinnostunut, mutta jotain vaatimuksia jää täyttämättä, niin ei haittaa. Hakemusta vain sisälle niin jutellaan. Meillä menestyy innovatiivinen henkilö, joka nauttii uusien tiedolla johtamisen ratkaisujen keksimisestä vakuutustoiminnan tarpeisiin.Miksi sinun kannattaa tarttua tilaisuuteen?Data ja sen kehittäminen on keskeinen osa Fennian strategiaa, joten meillä pääset merkittävään rooliin tiedolla johdetussa vakuutusyhtiössä. Pääset kehittämään, vaikuttamaan ja hyödyntämään osaamistasi laajasti. Työyhteisömme on ammattitaitoinen ja motivoitunut. Fennian arvoihin oletkin jo tutustunut, jos luit ilmoituksen tarkasti. Ne ovat Yhdessä, Reilu, Vastuullisesti rohkea ja Kehittyvä.Tarjoamme vakituisen työtehtävän vakavaraisessa ja vahvan perustan omaavassa vakuutusalan konsernissa, jossa vallitsee edistämisen kulttuuri. Kattavan perehdytyksen lisäksi rohkaisemme työntekijöitämme jatkuvaan itsensä kehittämiseen ja tarjoammekin aktiivisesti mahdollisuuksia lisäkoulutukseen. Näin mahdollistamme sinulle kehittyvän tehtäväkentän ja mielekkäät työtehtävätTulet työskentelemään hyvien kulkuyhteyksien varrella Triplan läheisyydessä Länsi-Pasilassa. Arkea sujuvoittavat liukuva työaika ja mahdollisuus etätyöhön. Koemme, että työhyvinvoinnista huolehtiminen on tärkeämpää kuin koskaan ennen, ja tuemme henkilöstömme hyvinvointia mm. liikunta-, pyörä- ja vakuutuseduin. Tavoitteenamme on, että jokainen fennialainen voi yhdistää työn ja vapaa-ajan hyvinvointia maksimoivalla tavalla.Kiinnostuitko tehtävästä? Hae siis nyt!Lisätietoja tehtävästä antaa Cloud Data Platform Manager Juha Järvi, jonka tavoitat parhaiten keskiviikkoisin klo 12-13 numerosta 040 178 4629.Pyrimme löytämään sopivat henkilöt mahdollisimman pian, joten hakemus kannattaa jättää heti. Haethan kuitenkin viimeistään 30.11. Haastattelemme hakijoita jo hakuaikana ja myös valintoja voidaan tehdä ennen hakuajan päättymistä.Toimintamme Fennialla perustuu vastuullisuuteen ja luottamukseen, joten vakituiseen ja pitkään määräaikaiseen työsuhteeseen tulevalle teetetään työhöntulotarkastus, johon sisältyy huumausainetesti.Fennia arvostaa yhdenvertaisuutta ja monimuotoisuutta työyhteisössä. Meille ovat tervetulleita kaikki hakijat taustoista, iästä, sukupuolesta ja eri kieli-, kulttuuri- ja vähemmistöryhmistä riippumatta.

required_skills: Computer Science, Data Warehousing, Databases, and Extract, Transform, Load (ETL)Business Understanding, Communication, Data Modeling, Snowflake, Snowflake Cloud, and Wizard
location: Schibsted Finland · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland  2 days ago  · 29 applicants
job_description:
THE OPPORTUNITY IN A NUTSHELLYou? A data engineer with an analytic mindset or an analyst with data engineering skills. Whether you have a few years of experience or have been around for a while, we’re interested in hearing from you.Role? As a Data Warehouse Engineer in our company, you will take part in constructing state-of-the-art Data Warehouses tailored for Nordic Marketplaces, empowering data-informed decisions. You will collaborate closely with stakeholders and cross-functional teams to engineer robust, agile solutions.Tech stack? AWS, Snowflake, Redshift, Matillion, Python, DBT, TableauLocation? You can apply to work at one of our hubs in Aarhus or Helsinki. Most of us work some days from home a couple of days a week and love meeting our colleagues weekly for collaboration. If you like, you can of course work from the office every day.Company? FINN.no in Norway, Bilbasen and DBA in Denmark, Oikotie and Tori in Finland, and Blocket in Sweden, recently joined forces, collectively forming Schibsted Nordic Marketplaces. Together, we serve over 325 million monthly visits in the Nordics. By joining forces, we are on a transformative journey toward becoming a next-generation marketplace. To achieve this ambitious goal, we're building a marketplace platform that will propel our verticals (Jobs, Mobility, Real Estate, ReCommerce) to a leading position in all countries. Our technology unit is instrumental to our success story, deploying new code to production over 1800 times per week.Why us? In this role, you will have an unique opportunity to build and form the Data Warehouse for Nordic Marketplaces to empower the organisation to take data driven decisions. We believe that the best solutions come in collaboration with others and that freedom and a sense of responsibility are more effective than detailed management.Sounds like your cup of tea? Check out the details below!WHO ARE YOU? A data wizard with at least Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (Computer science, Mathematics, Statistics, Finance) Passionate about data as basis of analysis and decision support Profound business understanding and communication skills Manages fundamental data modelling techniques relevant to data warehousing Experience with our tech stack or equivalent ETL/ELT tools like Talend, BODS, Informatica or other data wrangling tools like DBT, Databricks, Fivetran, Spark, Airflow etc and you don’t need ChatGPT to write your SQL Experience with AWS services like Snowflake, S3, Lambda or other cloud platforms and comparable tools 
WHAT’S THE JOB LIKE?Day-to-day work & projects cookingAs a part of our team you will work in close collaboration with both domain teams and analysts as well as your peers within our team and sister teams. Having a structured and analytical mindset is essential, as well as being able to decipher domain data models and data products, and transform those into analytical models to support business requirements by analysts and other stakeholders. You will be working with building high quality data pipelines to feed those models for different verticals as well as horizontal models across. This will be done using the Schibsted Common Analytical Model as one of the core building blocks.ColleaguesWe are a large, distributed and highly diverse team spread across most out the Nordics and Poland. Our team consists of 12 people, with broad diversity in both background and age-span. We're part of the data platform area, together with other teams like data platform engineering, data management, recommendation as well as data enablement teams for data science and data mesh. We are one out of 50 teams of talented individuals with diverse backgrounds, intellects and identities.We work closely with the technical domain teams to understand the data we are dealing with as well as our main stakeholders within insight and analysts as well as functions like finance and sales. We work according to agile principles with continuous deployment and improvements. We meet up several times during the year in our different locations.Not everything is cotton candy clouds, so here’s the main opportunity to improveRight now we are navigating around in the new, Nordic organisation, balancing both the legacy systems while building the new stuff, which is both demanding and exciting at the same time.On the other hand, this brings along a great opportunity to leave your fingerprint on how our future Data Warehouse is drafted and to support the rest of the organisation with key metrics and analyses both during and after the transition! Is your curious mind asking for this kind of adventure?GOT YOUR ATTENTION? Let us hear from you!If you are looking for a workplace and the role in which you could share your knowledge and expertise, learn and grow, get inspired, be yourself, and make a difference, let us hear from you by 20.11.2023. We value diversity and welcome applicants from all backgrounds.QUESTIONS?Engineering Manager Kristin Hybertsen is happy to provide information about the daily work and answer any questions you may have about the role. Kristin is best reached through Linkedin or email kristin.hybertsen(at)schibsted.com

required_skills: Artificial Intelligence (AI), Cloud Computing, Databases, Extract, Transform, Load (ETL), Microsoft Azure, and SQLData Modeling, Infrastructure, Master Data, and Microsoft SQL Server
location: Cloud1 Oy · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland Reposted  3 weeks ago  · Over 50 applicants
job_description:
Cloud1 tunnetaan vaativien integraatio-, arkkitehtuuri- ja dataratkaisujen toteuttajana. Tehtävämme on kehittää asiakkaidemme liiketoimintaa ja tuottaa heille kilpailuetua. Teemme sen rakentamalla älykkäitä pilvipohjaisia ratkaisuja Microsoft Azure -teknologialla. Olemme monialainen dataosaajien joukko, ja ainutlaatuinen tapamme työskennellä on saanut laajasti kiitosta. Näemme, että maailmassa on paikka meidän tavallamme tehdä asioita.Kiinnostavatko sinua Azure tekeminen sekä data platform kehittäminen? Ovatko visionäärisyys, modernit teknologiat, työympäristö sekä järkevät toimintatavat sinulle avaintekijöitä? Meillä tehdään töitä hyvässä hengessä yhteistyössä kumppaneiden ja asiakkaiden kanssa. Edistämme aidosti niin omia kuin asiakkaiden kyvykkyyksiä hyödyntäen Azuren teknologioita ja käytäntöjä.MeistäOlemme nopeasti kasvava Azuren data-analytiikka ratkaisuihin erikoistuva konsulttitalo, joka auttaa yrityksiä maksimoimaan dataan pohjautuvan päätöksen teon ja sen hyödyntämisen potentiaalin. Arvoihimme kuuluvat – Inhimillisyys, Reiluus, Visionäärisyys, Ammattimaisuus sekä Asiantuntijuus, mitkä näkyvät toiminnassamme. Cloud1 on 2012 vuonna perustettu neljän Microsoftin teknologiaekspertin toimesta. Nykyään yli 70-henkinen yritys koostuu raudankovista osaajista sekä tulevaisuuden lupauksista. Meillä on vankka ymmärrys integraatioista, tietokannoista, raportoinnista sekä infrastruktuurista. Olemme Microsoftin kumppaneita seuraavissa kategorioissa: Digital & App Innovation, Data & AI sekä Infrastructure, jotka mahdollistavat pääsyn ensimmäisten joukossa uusiin teknologioihin sekä toimimisen haastavissa ja mielenkiintoisissa projekteissa. Takana on jo yli 600 Azure- ja data-alusta projektia.Meillä pääset toteuttamaan vaihtelevia ja haastaviakin hankkeita yhdessä alan kovimpien osaajien kanssa. Rohkaisemme sinua kehittämään osaamistasi jatkuvasti, ja tarjoamme käyttöösi aina uusimmat Azure-teknologiat. Vaikka saatkin vapautta ja vastuuta työsi tekemiseen, emme Cloud1:lla työskentele yksin. Tiimi ja koko Cloud1-yhteisö ovat aina tukenasi rennolla ja hyvällä meiningillä ilman turhaa byrokratiaa. Tervetuloa mukaan innostavaan ja kehittävään työyhteisöön!TehtävänkuvausAzure Data Engineer -roolissa suunnittelet ja toteutat teknisiä ratkaisuja vaihtelevissa pilviprojekteissa alan uusimmilla teknologioilla. Hyödynnät osaamistasi tietokannoista, integraatioista ja tietomallinnuksesta asiakkaidemme liiketoiminnan kehittämiseksi. Voit vaikuttaa omaan tehtävänkuvaasi osaamisesi, vahvuuksiesi ja toiveidesi mukaan.Sinulla on muutaman vuoden kokemus tietovarastoinnista (esim. ETL) tai integraatioista, ja erityisesti Microsoft SQL Server -tietokannoista. Toivomme sinulta teknisten taitojen lisäksi kokemusta tiimityöstä asiakasrajapinnassa ja kykyä edistää kehitystyötä itsenäisesti. Arvostamme kokemusta Azuresta, Microsoft on-premises -analytiikkaratkaisuista ja Master Data Managementista, mutta kokemusta tärkeämpää on halusi oppia ja kehittyä kivenkovaksi Azure-osaajaksi.Azure Data Engineerin työtehtävät voivat vaihdella projekteittain, mutta tehtäviisi voi kuulua esimerkiksi: Tietovarastojen ja data-alustojen suunnittelu ja toteutus Azure-pilvessäDatan integrointi eri järjestelmistä AzureenAnalytiikkaratkaisujen suunnittelu ja toteutus Azure-pilvessäDatamallinnuksen suunnittelu ja toteutusTietoturvallisuuden varmistaminen datan käsittelyssäTiimityöskentely asiakkaiden ja muiden sidosryhmien kanssa
Työhön liittyvät edutHaluamme sinun viihtyvän meillä ja suoriutuvan työsi tekemisestä niin, että sinulla on siihen tarvittavat edut ja työvälineet. Tätä tukeaksemme tarjoamme sinulle:Modernit työvälineetKannustava bonusmalliHenkilöstön palkkiorahasto ja osakeantiSertifioinnit ja erilliset koulutuksetLaaja työterveyshuolto sekä vapaa-ajan tapaturmavakuutusLiikunta- ja kulttuurietu, hierontaetu, työmatkaetu ja lounasetuPuhelinetuOma CS & PUBG-tiimi sekä erilaiset harrastekerhotVirkistystoiminta – tapahtumat ja yhteiset aamiaisetAamiais- ja välipalatarvikkeet toimistollaVuosittainen etätyömatka mukavien työkavereiden kanssaToimistomme sijaitsee Vuorikadulla aivan Helsingin ytimessä, hyvien kulkuyhteyksien äärellä. Työtä tehdään hybridimallilla eli osittain toimistolla ja valitsemastasi paikasta.Kiinnostuitko?Hae uuteen vakituiseen tehtävään alla olevan painikkeen kautta, tai ota yhteyttä ja kysy lisää! Hakuaika päättyy 31.10.

required_skills: Artificial Intelligence (AI), Computer Science, Data Mining, Data Science, MLOps, Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing (NLP), Pattern Recognition, and Software DevelopmentCadence Encounter
location: Wolt · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland Reposted  3 days ago  · Over 50 applicants
job_description:
Job DescriptionTeam purpose and mission Working embedded with Data Scientists and other engineers to develop, deploy, scale and maintain impactful Machine Learning solutionsHelping data scientists and other engineers with Machine Learning and ML Platform & infrastructure related topics and questions. Increasing the level of ML engineering in the team.Monitoring, maintenance and troubleshooting of deployed solutionsContributing to our MLOps practices and liaising with the ML Platform teamWe have openings in multiple domains, such as personalisation & recommendations, search, logistics etc.
📍This role can be based in one of our tech hubs in Helsinki, Berlin or Stockholm, or you can work remotely anywhere in Finland, Sweden, Germany, Denmark, and Estonia. Read more about our remote setup here. If you live outside of these countries - not to worry! We provide relocation support to help you make your way to Finland, Germany or Sweden.Our humble expectations You are experienced in end-to-end machine learning deployments and maintenance of deployed solutions and have at least 3+ years of experience in ML/MLOps.Furthermore, you bring solid experience in scaling and troubleshooting machine learning deployments to the table. You can help with the technical issues the teams encounter.A good understanding of ML and MLOps principles as well as Software engineering experience in Python should complete your profile.Ideally you also have experience in Docker, Kubernetes, Flyte, Seldon Core.
Next StepsThe position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Michal SzafraniecAbout WoltWolt is a technology company that makes it incredibly easy to discover and get the best restaurants, grocery stores and other local shops delivered to your home or office. Wolt is not just a delivery app – we’re a technology company building a commerce platform to seamlessly connect our millions of customers with thousands of merchant and courier partners, in real-time across 23 countries and 250+ cities. Our apps (iOS and Android) have the industry’s highest ratings, largely thanks to our customer-first-mindset, which shows in how we build products and run operations. In June 2022 we officially joined forces with DoorDash. Combined, we have a presence in 27 countries, 23 of which operate with the Wolt brand and app. Wolt and DoorDash continue largely independently, with Wolt’s name, brand, product, technology and team.Working in Product Development at WoltAt Wolt, we’re about getting things done. You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 400+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we’re the very core of Wolt’s products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 40 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & InclusionWe want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.Join us today to build Wolt together!
 
Job Description
Working embedded with Data Scientists and other engineers to develop, deploy, scale and maintain impactful Machine Learning solutionsHelping data scientists and other engineers with Machine Learning and ML Platform & infrastructure related topics and questions. Increasing the level of ML engineering in the team.Monitoring, maintenance and troubleshooting of deployed solutionsContributing to our MLOps practices and liaising with the ML Platform teamWe have openings in multiple domains, such as personalisation & recommendations, search, logistics etc.

Helsinki

You are experienced in end-to-end machine learning deployments and maintenance of deployed solutions and have at least 3+ years of experience in ML/MLOps.Furthermore, you bring solid experience in scaling and troubleshooting machine learning deployments to the table. location: Rovio Entertainment Corporation · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland Reposted  2 weeks ago  · Over 50 applicants
job_description:
At Rovio you will get to work with one of the most famous games IP’s in the world: Angry Birds. Our mission is to “craft joy” for the wide audience that we reach with our games and products. In order to do that, we know that people need to bring their own joy to what we do. That’s why we value work-life balance, say no to crunch culture, and welcome people from all walks of life to join the flock. Today, we are a proud team of 500+ caring and talented professionals representing 54 different nations.We trust our teams to work autonomously by providing them the right tools and level of responsibility. We believe in our teams to remain creative and to keep learning – as well as ensuring everyone has opportunities for personal growth.Data is at the heart of everything we do at Rovio. It enables us to continually improve our games and provide incredible experiences for the millions of users who play our games every day. All of this data is only valuable if it can be used to guide our day to day operations. It is the job of Rovio data craft to turn that raw data into actionable insights for Rovio’s games teams and other business units. The data craft aims to empower Rovio’s teams with insightful data, and also with relevant tools and models that support decision making.We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst who will be a main driver of Ads growth opportunities based on data insights.You will have fun at work by doing: Product/Roadmap Prioritization:Develop in collaboration with the Ad’s team stakeholders, short to mid-term data project roadmap Define priorities and work allocation on weekly meetings with Ads TeamReporting:Building data pipelines and automated analyses using modern scripting methodsBuilding meaningful dashboards that answer business questions and improve decision makingParticipate in data harmonisation processes by defining requirements, implementing ETL processes and ensuring data qualityInsights:Own data-driven projects from ideation to execution and collaborate with business owners and analytics peers alikeStudy changes in key metrics and long-term trends and forecasting Work with game teams to identify white space opportunities for Ads

The goal is to discuss your career ambitions and expectations, and also how you would fit with our working culture.
